comment: Highly recommend. Attendance not mandatory but extremely advised. Lectures engaging and informative.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Really enjoyed this class, by far the best Digital Logic Professor at KSU!! Attendance not mandatory, but extremely helpful. If you attend the classes and do the homework, you'll be fine. Workload very reasonable.
If you want to pass you must attend class the lecture are heavy. He explains them very well.
Amazing professor 100% recommend taking it with him. You will learn.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Amazing professor all the way around. Very caring and relatable!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Kazemian was an excellent teacher! Felt like there was a bit of busywork with the homework, but the tests and labs and homework are easy if you pay attention in class. 100% would take again.

Dr. Kazemian is easily the best EE professor I've had at KSU. Fantastic person and very caring - he was always very kind and answered questions very quickly. This class is a lot of work (not necessarily difficult, but very time consuming) but Dr. K prepares you very well if you attend lectures (which you must), making it challenging but enjoyable!

Dr. Kazemian's lectures are good. However, this semester he seemed short on time and went through many chapters quickly. Some topics that appeared on the test were barely covered in class. He is a nice person and genuinely cares about his students, but I don't think he has been able to teach as effectively as he did in the past.
He is just amazing. No faults really. Everything you would want in a professor. He is so good makes me wonder why he isn't at GT or some elite Uni

AMAZING PROF! Weekly HW assignments and biweekly labs. 2 exams and a Final. Engaging lectures and very encouraging to participate in class. Dr. Alan is the sole reason why I didn't drop out as a transfer student, he made me feel competent. He makes himself available for the labs and shows you how to troubleshoot your circuit.Dont skip his class tho

Professor Kazemian is one of the best professor I ever had in my entire college path at Kennesaw State University, he really knows the material and his classes are fun. He makes you learn the material by explaining every detail and also through the homework and lab reports. His test are just about what he teaches in class, very nice person and prof

Probably the coolest Professor I've had. He's a young and understanding professor, if you have a good reason for something he will be more than happy to help you. He is great at communicating outside of class, will get back to you in a few hours or even faster. You high key have to be slow to get below a B in his class, not even fail.
The professor is clear about what he wants you to do to succeed and is amazing at teaching. Attendance is not mandatory but you should go to class, his lectures teach everything for the class.

A great young professor who knows the subject well and breaks it down into simple, understandable terms. Attending class is very beneficial and makes the labs and homework much more manageable. Overall, I enjoyed the class and highly recommend it to anyone needing to take the course.

Professor Alan Kazemian is an outstanding instructor for EE2305, Electronic Circuit and Machine. His teaching style is incredibly straightforward, though can be random. He has a practical approach to teaching, focusing on what students need to know and cutting out unnecessary fluff. If you consistently show up and take notes, its an easy A
Professor Kazemian was one of the best Instructors I have ever taken. He really cares about the students learning and is hilarious in class. He is the Logic King

Just powerpoints and YT videos as his lectures but easy to follow. You can work at your own pace to finish all of his assignments, he set his due dates to the weekend before the final exam. The only hard due date are the tests which were not that hard since his material was easy to follow and understand. Quick responses if you need help.

This man is one of the best professors I've had at KSU. I took his class online during Spring 2021 and he was great. Lectures were online, non-synchronous. Actually he didn't really give lectures, just uploaded PowerPoints and YouTube videos. This isn't a bad thing though. He is also very accessible when you have questions. A+ Prof.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I thought that this course being taught by Professor Kazemian was by far the simplest course I have taken this semester. He was helpful with all the questions I had asked and responded to my emails and questions very quickly and graded fair. All the material was easy to follow with him and the labs gave us a great hands-on experience.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Kazemian was amazing and very helpful during Covid19 protocols at the college. He removed due dates and helped the class focus on the hands on learning so that we could understand the theory as well as the practical. 1 homework a week as well as handwritten notes/powerpoints and videos helped me retain everything nicely. Absolutely Great

So, as of spring 2021, he has set up his class to online, with QA once/twice a month. Haven't seen this professor since the first day of class, which he decided to make everything online. Prefers to just post YouTube videos, or lecture powerpoints (with no answer) online. Defeats the purpose of getting an in-person professor to begin with.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Kazemian is great. Sadly, I had to take this class fully online but it was handled very well. Everything was available online that we needed to be successful in the class. Very accessible through text or email and was very helpful if I needed to ask a question. 10/10 will take again if he decides to teach any upper level classes.

No hesitation, take this prof. Online course - Lecture 100%, one in person lab to make sure you understand wiring. I wish I could have taken the in person lectures, he seems like a great person and teacher. Content is pretty straight forward and he is ALWAYS available for questions. He wants you to actually learn the material.

One of the best professor I have ever had. Most of the class was online (covid) ,but he provided ALL the information we needed to do the homework, labs, and tests. Labs were basically the same level as homework. He made learning easy, accessible, and as least stressful as possible. Tests were open book, and just wants to see everyone succeed !
He's great. My only complaint is that COVID turned this in-person class into an online class. I would've loved to learn from him in person.

Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had for the funnest class I've ever had. Lectures are clear and to the point and I found AK's lecture style to be refreshing since he focuses a lot on the practical points. 100% recommend this professor.

One of the best professors that I've had so far in my college experience! He was very willing to answer questions in or out of class, and very accessible. Great at making otherwise difficult content very easy to understand. I wouldn't say it's a "show up and pass" sort of class-he expects you to actually learn the content, makes it easy to do so.

Professor Kazemian was an amazing professor and one of the best I have had at KSU. He is very clear in instruction and makes sure everyone is caught upon the subject before he moves on. Cannot applaud him enough for his teaching
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Kazemian is one of the best professors I've ever had, he makes sure that you understand that content, and he does practical examples of almost everything to make sure that you're not left in the dark with just theoretical examples. He's always really willing to help if you try. If you can get his class, take it, you won't regret it.

He made the transition to online classes during the covid-19 pandemic more bearable as he is a super relaxed and understanding professor. His class is more hands on with being lab oriented and you'll become pretty skilled with prototyping by the end. Bottom line one of the nicest professors Ive ever had. I wish he taught more classes at KSU.
Great Professor, cares for his students. Very accommodating during COVID-19 pandemic with grading and material. Makes you love the material.

I learned a ton in his class. He went over a ton of examples in class and wrote up his notes so you could view them after class and he didn't just read off of a power point. Also he explained the inside of the IC chips we were going to use which made all of the labs extremely easy. The only problem is his class fills up quick because he's so good
Literally one of the best professors I've had at KSU. He cares a lot about his students and was very accommodating during the quarantine. Highly recommend.

Easily one of the best professors I have ever had. The class has difficult topics that don't feel so difficult due to the way he teaches. He focuses on what you really need to learn from the class for future classes and projects. Wish I could have him again for future classes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Alan Kazemian is an amazing professor. He makes the class so interesting. He is young and very passionate. There are three tests and a final. The homework and quizzes prepare one for the final. He responds to emails quickly. I would recommend him.

Honestly one of the best professors I have ever taken. The class is not an easy class but Kazemian akes it easy. He is very good at explaining things and makes everything easy to understand and practical. More than anything he cares about practicality (what you will actually use). he doesn't do any "extra" or "pointless assignment. 15/10 recommend!

To be honest, this class is not easy. But he explains hard topics in a way that it helps you understand easily. You can take this class without any doubts. He will help you outside office hours and responds quickly.

Alan Kazemian is one of the best professors in EE. He teaches exactly what you need to know in the most clear and easy to understand way I've ever had. You will still struggle if you don't put in the effort, but he really helps students learn the concepts and is very accessible outside class for help. Teaches practical applications for everything.

Such an amazing professor and his lectures are extremely clear. The assignments that are given not only helps us learn the material, but also helps us prepare for the tests. The labs were sometimes difficult, but he has no problem with helping. This is not a gimme class in a long shot, but he prepares us students for success rather than failure.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: We need more professors like him. His teaching method is great! Lessons are straight to the point without all the uneccesary busy work. Labs are a gem and get you thinking! I didn't know how to wire a breadboard before this class but now i do. The tests are challenging but doable. Also he's very quick at responding to emails and working with you.
Professor Kazemian, is an amazing instructor who does an amazing job. He actively wants students to work and understand the class material. Take if you can.

Kazemian is a great professor that is more than willing to work with you if you show you're putting forth the effort and everything he reviews with you is clearly laid out on the test. The labs ramp up in difficulty the longer you're in the class but he is willing to answer questions you have to make sure you know what you're doing

He is an awesome Professor, he always helps, even outside class he responds quickly. He makes the material easy for us to understand. Even very helpful during labs. Labs and hw are pretty straight forward and short.

Prof Kazemian is a great professor. I would highly recommend taking him for Digital Logic Design. He gives homework and quizzes that prepare you for the test. The test are very fair, and over the material that he teaches in class exactly. Implements challenging design problems in quizzes/test that make you use concepts learned in class.

Alan hands down was the best professor I have ever taken. I took this class with a different professor last year and I withdrew from the course. I took it with Alan and I got an A with flying colors. He knows his stuff and he teaches the material so very well, to the point where I decided to do a patent with my knowledge of this course. Outstanding

He honestly has the students best interest in mind. He stripped the class down to only what was necessary with a focus on understanding over repetition. He was very patient with questions and thorough with his responses.

He is an amazing professor that doesn't make digital logic hard to understand. He puts a larger focus on the hands on with the labs. He also in the spring semester used only 1 of the scheduled 2 class sessions per week, which made the class just that much better. The tests were fair, and homework for completion grade. Overall he is awesome.

he is the greatest guy and professor who I ve ever taken. his materials are useful ( he doesnt teach any useless) and he always is on our side. His exams, homework, quizzes are easy (if you dont miss any class). if I have a chance to take him again, I will definitely take him again.
If You Know what you're doing in class and know all the assignments that he assigns like quiz or homework, you will get an A for this course.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I got a lot from the course in regards to understanding digital logic. The syllabus ended up being somewhat disjointed from the original, but everything worked out. I appreciate that he condensed everything into half the class periods.
kazemian is a great teacher, he know how to easliy distill information so that anyone can understand and apply that information to test.
Digital was super easy with him. Heard it is a difficult class. Easy A. He's fair and easy to work with.

Its an Easy A in the class if you pay attention in the class, go to class, and work on your labs ahead of time. He wants to makes sure you understand the material, so ask questions if needed. reallly goood teacher
Teaches you all you need and leaves out the BS. I would come to class as his notes he puts on the board are directly reflected in his tests.

You won't get a free grade if you don't show up to class and don't put in your effort. At the end of the day, he wants the students to learn the material and remember it, not just to take a test and forget the material a week later. He doesn't burden you with so many assignments, but use the given assignments/Labs to actually learn. He is amazing!
Class where you actually learn things. The only professor I felt like I want to share memes with.
THE professor to take for Digital Logic. Chang is good too but if you can take Kazemian DO IT! Meet once a week, labs are straight forward and you actually learn the material.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Enjoy the class.

ALAN get better comebacks for annoying people in class that ask 1000 redundant and unnecessary questions instead of just answering them every single time... & when said people chime sooo much. v annoying honestly. Like askin for more practice questions.. instead of going later and doing that a good comeback is "you can google for some more Q's...."

Professor Kazemian's class is a relatively stress-free environment with low amounts of stress. Digital logic can be a bit tricky for people who have never been introduced to it before but Professor Kazemian breaks down the material into simple steps that make it easy to understand the concepts.
Kazemian is amazing. He will not give you busy work, simplifies hard concepts and makes them easy. Will not teach you unnecessary info.

Kazemian is one of the professor that genuinely made me very interested and attracted to the class. He is a very understanding with students, extremely efficient in course material, and humorous during class. His quizzes and tests strike a good balance in study and to anyone, I definitely would recommend taking him if you want to have a good time.
Made the class super easy!

He is the best professor I have ever taken. He condensed the class into once a week and it was without a doubt worth it. He really cares about his students and is always available to help. He has got to be the best professor I have ever taken. Must Take!!
Show up to class, it's pretty easy. Interesting class. Mostly take home labs.

Professor Kazemian is undoubtedly the best professor you can take for DLD. He is extremely aware of what students need to get out of the class and doesn't waste any time on the extra. He offered to only meet once a week rather than two and I recommend you take it, he knows what he is doing during lecture. His quizzes/tests are straightforward.

Professor Alan is hands down the BEST and only want the BEST for his students. All grades were graded and handed back on time. He compressed a two-day lecture into 1 day per week, which worked well for those of us that have work and families. He allow late work up until final day of class because he wanted us to learn the material. MUST TAKE!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Kazemian explains things really well, assigns Labs every other week, and has fair exams that are based on what is covered in class. There is no textbook for this course.

His lectures are clear and to the point. The labs could've been done better in my opinion. All but the first one were take home so you'd be on your own but they weren't terrible. Sometimes we'd be given a homework and it would be due the same day as the quiz, so if you had trouble on the homework you might not know how to do the quiz.
Very Smart and very helpful in my digital logic lab class! Better than my lecturer! Would definitely take again!

He is the best professor I ever taken. He makes sure we understand the material. The quizzes and tests are easy if you pay attention in class and do the homework, the homework is for completion, and the labs are easy if you know the concepts. He also does some extra credit. Every professor should be like him.
He is what you wish all of your professors were like. He never tries to trick you on a test and will always tell you what you need to know.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Professor Alan is simply great. He explain the concepts of Digital Logic very clearly and even shows you where they are applied in real life. His grading is really fair and as long as you do the homework and show up, this class should be alright 1000% recommend
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Clear grading criteria--Would take again
